ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing capital increase type transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: Valid transaction code to be utilised by the SYSTEM when processing standard Capital Increase type transactions.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.

1-3 Alpha numeric characters, (type 'S'). To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).
Must exist as a valid Security Transaction Name (SC.TRANS.NAME).
Details the latest date at which a Customer should reply to an offer letter.
Currently 5 days is hard coded. This facility will be developed at a later date.
Examples: Where the subscription period for a New Issue or Capital Increase is between 01 DEC and 7 DEC the Customers' reply must be received 5 days (working days) before 7 DEC.
1-2 characters. (Mandatory input).
Valid transaction code to be utilised by the SYSTEM when processing Standard Capital Increase type transactions.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities
Examples: Reverse Split.
1-3 Alpha numeric characters, (type 'S'). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Security Transaction Name (SC.TRANS.NAME).
Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application.

9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
Must exist as a valid company code.
Specifies "Own Account Trading/Investment" portfolio.
Y or blank
The type of Delivery expected with any Capital Increase type transaction. The assumed delivery code.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type 'S'). Mandatory input. Examples: Free Delivery of stock in Delivery against payment etc.
Must exist as a valid Security Delivery Instruction (SC. DEL. Instr) code.
Where entered it dictates the standard default nominee code for all Capital Increase type transactions.
Note: The nominee code when entered forms part of the position key used for storing details of securities held.
Great care should be used therefore when using the Nominee Code in whatever Application.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type 'S') Standard nominee code. Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.
